properties.description: Posted by Visdeerfield, IllinoisThis is where I spent two of the best years of my life, Carlson [CIT] 104.

properties.name: Breakfast on a Tuesday
properties.description: Posted by VisI was eating at the cafeteria. Someone said, "a plane ran into the towers." I thought it was some minor accident, but I said a prayer for the situation anyway before I ate some eggs.

properties.name: Childhood home
properties.description: Posted by Vis This is where I grew up, and where I returned for sanctuary after college and seminary.

properties.name: Dealey Plaza, Dallas, Texas
properties.description: Posted by VisOn our way to a missions trip we stopped to see the place where JFK was shot. How morbid is that?

properties.name: Freiburg, Germany
properties.description: Posted by VisA city in the Black Forest, one of my favorite stops in Europe.

properties.name: Garden of the gods Park, CO
properties.description: Posted by VisGarden of the gods Park, COMy uncle got married near here. My parents and I got caught in a rain storm while hiking around here and got absolutely soaked.

properties.name: Garmisch, Germany
properties.description: Posted by VisIf I could live anywhere in the world, it might be somewhere in Garmisch.

properties.name: Green Tortise Hostel, Seattle, WA
properties.description: Posted by VisI spent several days here in Seattle, it\'s a nice place. Seattle is very hilly, bring good shoes. I wish I had.

properties.name: Havana
properties.description: Posted by VisI think it\'d be nice to go to Cuba and have an actual Cuban cigar.

properties.name: Italian Riviera
properties.description: Posted by VisA fun place to hike and then swim.

properties.name: L.A., California
properties.description: Posted by VisMy uncle used to live in California. I hate the Lakers, and consdier L.A. to be one of the worst places ever for many reasons.

properties.name: Lahina, Hawaii
properties.description: Posted by VisLocated on the west side of the island of Maui. I went here courtesy of my cousin Suzie, after graduating high school [99].

properties.name: Manlantis
properties.description: Posted by VisMy Portland home; it has a wonderful backyard.

properties.name: MoMA, New York City
properties.description: Posted by Vis 11 West 53 Street, New York CityHome of Van Gogh\'s Starry Night, we got in for free, suckahs.

properties.name: Monterrey, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by VisI\'ve been here twice, building churches and the like.

properties.name: Montreal
properties.description: Posted by VisI\'ve heard this is like a modern Paris. It would be my first stop, via Chicago of course.

properties.name: Paris
properties.description: Posted by VisGreat art, I prefer the Musee d\'Orsay.

properties.name: Patagonia
properties.description: Posted by VisI\'ve seen some pictures, and this may be one of the most beautiful places on the earth.

properties.name: Peru
properties.description: Posted by VisI\'d love to visit my friend Monica in Lima and then hike the ol\' Machu Picchu.

properties.name: Q3
properties.description: Posted by VisThis is the quad, where I spent my last semester at college. It was a glorious semester.

properties.name: Reykjavík, Iceland
properties.description: Posted by VisIt has a very nice airport, though at 6 am after three hours of sleep I wasn\'t terribly interested in going outside, only to get through security again.

properties.name: Roma
properties.description: Posted by VisHome of the Vatican, lots of stray cats, heat strokes and cool old stuff.

properties.name: Somewhere in the hills
properties.description: Posted by VisGalaxNo exact location for this one, but somewhere around there is where my mom\'s dad lived and wrote for several small newspapers. I never met him, as he died when my mom was 18. She says we\'d get along real well.

properties.name: Stuvis
properties.description: Posted by VisI lived here for half a year. We had a fooseball table.

properties.name: TBPM
properties.description: Posted by Vis670 Washington St. Dorchester, MA 02124 This is where I spent the summer of 2001, ministering in the "hood" of Boston.

properties.name: Tonalli's Donuts & Cream
properties.description: Posted by Vis2805 Northeast Alberta Street, Portland, OR, 97211Donuts, ice cream and cheap hot dogs: what more could one ask for? Plus they\'re open late.
